sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"健康的，强健的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: healthy, sound, robust, well, strong, vigorous, sturdy, tough, wholesome, fit
means: healthy ： 指身体无病，也可指身心健全、正常的。
sound ： 侧重身体各部分或器官没有病，无任何缺陷，即健康。
well ： 仅指没有疾病，但不一定很健康。
strong ： 既指体格健壮，又指体力或精神上的力量。
vigorous ： 指人强健有力，精力充沛。
sturdy ： 侧重于结实的体格。
tough ： 着重指人的体格健壮。
wholesome ： 多指能给人留下身体健康、思想健全或品德良好等印象。
fit ： 既可指健壮又可指健全无病。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"声音"之意。
means: noise ： 通常指不悦耳的、令人烦恼的嘈杂声，隐含贬义。
sound ： 普通用词，含义笼统，指人们能听到的各种声音，无褒贬色彩。
voice ： 指人说话或唱歌时发出的声音。

word_mean: 声，音：空气和其它介质振动对听觉器官及其中枢联系产生的效应
声波：机械辐射能，介质(空气、水或固体)微粒沿传播线(纵向)运动
频率在每秒8～2000周的声波(能)可刺激主观听觉
探子：插入体腔内检测异物或扩张狭窄的一种器械
噪音：身体可内听到的正常或异常的声音
有关其它音见bruit， fremitus， murmur和rale

sentence.Network_en: This may sound trivial, but I assure you it is quite important!
sentence.Network_cn: 这听上去也许微不足道，但是，相信我，它十分重要！

sentence.Network_en: "Does it sound like music?" — "I wouldn't go that far."
sentence.Network_cn: “这听上去像音乐吗？”——“我可不那样认为。”

sentence.Network_en: He did not sound as if he believed her.
sentence.Network_cn: 他听起来似乎并不相信她。

lj.lj_ly: was always sounding off about higher taxes.
lj.lj_ls: 总是就更高税收有力地抒发自己的见解

jx.jx_en_mean: To count cadence when marching in military formation.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English soun, from Anglo-Norman French soun (noun), suner (verb), from Latin sonus. The form with -d was established in the 16th cent
Middle English: from Old English gesund, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch gezond and German gesund
late Middle English: from Old French sonder, based on Latin sub- 'below' + unda 'wave'
Middle English: from Old Norse sund 'swimming, strait'; related to swim

encyclopedia.content: Sound含义 函数名： sound 功 能： 以指定频率打开PC扬声器 用 法： void sound(unsigned frequency); 程序例： /* Emits a 7-Hz tone for 10 seconds. Your PC may not be able to emit a 7-Hz tone. */ #include <dos.h> int main(void) { sound(7); delay(10000); nosound(); return 0; } 专辑 专辑： SOUND 歌手： BEYOND 发行时间： 1995年 地区： 香港 语言： 粤语 专辑曲目： 01. 铁马骝 02. 教坏细路 03. 缺口 04.

entry.def: A sound is something that you hear.

example.ex: Peter heard the sound of gunfire...
example.tran: 彼德听见了枪炮声。

example.ex: Liza was so frightened she couldn't make a sound...
example.tran: 莉莎实在吓坏了，不敢弄出一点声音来。

entry.tran: 声(指通过空气、水或其他物质传播的一种能量)
entry.def: Sound is energy that travels in waves through air, water, or other substances, and can be heard.

example.ex: The aeroplane will travel at twice the speed of sound.
example.tran: 这架飞机的速度将是音速的两倍。

entry.tran: (电视、收音机、CD 机等可调节音量的)声音，音响
entry.def: The sound on a television, radio, or CD player is what you hear coming from the machine. Its loudness can be controlled.

example.ex: She went and turned the sound down...
example.tran: 她去把音量关小了。

example.ex: Compact discs have brought about a vast improvement in recorded sound quality.
example.tran: 激光唱片极大地提高了录音的音质。

entry.tran: (歌手或乐队的)音乐风格，乐曲特色
entry.def: A singer's or band's sound is the distinctive quality of their music.

example.ex: They have started showing a strong soul element in their sound...
example.tran: 他们的音乐风格开始表现出一种强烈的灵乐特色。

example.ex: He's got a unique sound and a unique style.
example.tran: 他的音乐风格独具特色。

entry.def: If something such as a horn or a bell sounds or if you sound it, it makes a noise.

example.ex: The buzzer sounded in Daniel's office...
example.tran: 丹尼尔办公室里的蜂音器响了。

example.ex: A young man sounds the bell to start the Sunday service.
example.tran: 一个年轻人鸣钟宣布周日的礼拜开始了。

entry.tran: 发出(警告等);(以…语调)发表
entry.def: If you sound a warning, you publicly give it. If you sound a note of caution or optimism, you say publicly that you are cautious or optimistic.

example.ex: The Archbishop of Canterbury has sounded a warning to Europe's leaders on third world debt...
example.tran: 坎特伯雷大主教就第三世界的债务问题向欧洲的领导人发出了警告。

example.ex: Others consider the move premature and have sounded a note of caution...
example.tran: 其他人认为采取这个行动为时尚早，对此提出了警告。

entry.def: When you are describing a noise, you can talk about the way it sounds .

example.ex: They heard what sounded like a huge explosion...
example.tran: 他们听见一声爆炸般的巨响。

example.ex: The creaking of the hinges sounded very loud in that silence...
example.tran: 在那片寂静之中，铰链吱吱嘎嘎的声音听起来很响。

entry.def: When you talk about the way someone sounds, you are describing the impression you have of them when they speak.

example.ex: She sounded a bit worried...
example.tran: 她的语气里有一点担心。

example.ex: Murphy sounds like a child...
example.tran: 墨菲的口气像个孩子。

entry.tran: (用于谈论印象或观点)听起来，似乎
entry.def: When you are describing your impression or opinion of something you have heard about or read about, you can talk about the way it sounds .

example.ex: It sounds like a wonderful idea to me, does it really work?...
example.tran: 听起来这个主意很不错，真的能行吗？

example.ex: It sounds as if they might have made a dreadful mistake...
example.tran: 听起来他们似乎犯下了一个可怕的错误。

entry.tran: (对于听说或读到的事情的)印象
entry.def: You can describe your impression of something you have heard about or read about by talking about the sound of it.

example.ex: Here's a new idea we liked the sound of...
example.tran: 这是个新想法，我们一听就喜欢。

example.ex: I don't like the sound of Toby Osborne...
example.tran: 我不喜欢托比·奥斯伯恩的那一套。

entry.tran: (身体)健康的;(心智)健全的;(建筑)坚固的
entry.def: If a structure, part of someone's body, or someone's mind is sound, it is in good condition or healthy.

example.ex: When we bought the house, it was structurally sound...
example.tran: 我们买下这栋房子的时候，它的结构还非常坚固。

example.ex: Although the car is basically sound, I was worried about certain areas...
example.tran: 尽管这辆汽车基本状况良好，我还是担心一些地方不够安全。

entry.tran: (建议、推理或证据)正确的，合理的，可靠的，明智的
entry.def: Sound advice, reasoning, or evidence is reliable and sensible.

example.ex: They are trained nutritionists who can give sound advice on diets...
example.tran: 他们都是受过训练的营养学家，能够在饮食方面提出合理的建议。

example.ex: Buy a policy only from an insurance company that is financially sound...
example.tran: 一定要从财务状况良好的保险公司购买保险。

entry.def: If you describe someone's ideas as sound, you mean that you approve of them and think they are correct.

example.ex: I am not sure that this is sound democratic practice...
example.tran: 我不能肯定这是正确的民主行为。

example.ex: I think the idea of secularism is a very sound one...
example.tran: 我认为现世主义的观点非常正确。

entry.def: If someone is in a sound sleep, they are sleeping very deeply.

example.ex: She had woken me out of a sound sleep.
example.tran: 她把我从酣睡中叫醒。

means.word_mean: 1. the particular auditory effect produced by a given cause;

sentences.sentence: "the sound of rain on the roof"

means.word_mean: 2. the subjective sensation of hearing something;

sentences.sentence: "he strained to hear the faint sounds"

means.word_mean: 3. mechanical vibrations transmitted by an elastic medium;

sentences.sentence: "falling trees make a sound in the forest even when no one is there to hear them"

means.word_mean: 4. the sudden occurrence of an audible event;
5. the audible part of a transmitted signal;

sentences.sentence: "they always raise the audio for commercials"

means.word_mean: 6. (phonetics) an individual sound unit of speech without concern as to whether or not it is a phoneme of some language
7. a narrow channel of the sea joining two larger bodies of water
8. a large ocean inlet or deep bay;

sentences.sentence: "the main body of the sound ran parallel to the coast"

means.word_mean: 2. make a certain noise or sound;
3. give off a certain sound or sounds;
4. announce by means of a sound;
7. measure the depth of (a body of water) with a sounding line
3. in good condition; free from defect or damage or decay;

sentences.sentence: "a sound mind in a sound body"

means.word_mean: 5. reflects weight of sound argument or evidence;

list.explanation: l大声说话(尤指长时间发牢骚)

example.en: The leaders have sounded off on various issues.
example.zh: 头头们在许多问题上大发了中牢骚。

example.en: Don't just sound off without raising your hand.
He's always sounding off about what a big shot he is.
example.zh: 他动不动就吹嘘自己是什么了不起的大人物。

example.en: Keep it a secret. Don't sound off about it.
example.zh: 这事要保守秘密，不要泄露出去。

auth_sentence.content: I'm starting to sound like a stuck record.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm starting to sound like a stuck record.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm starting to sound like a stuck record.

auth_sentence.content: This is a sound that's ready to explode.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is a sound that's ready to explode.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is a sound that's ready to explode.

auth_sentence.content: The sound takes ages to die away in Wormit.
auth_sentence.res_content: The sound takes ages to die away in Wormit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The sound takes ages to die away in Wormit.

Sentence.sentence: It sounds almost too good to be true.
That sounds like a bad deal for the power company, but it's not
Goldman Sachs, an investment bank, cancelled a conference in Las Vegas at the last minute and rebooked it in San Francisco, which cost more but sounded less fun.

sentences.en: She sounded a note of danger.

sentences.cn: 他们在探测河水的深度。

sentences.en: Will you sound John as to whether he would accept the post when offered?
sentences.cn: 你试探一下约翰的意见, 如果让他干的话, 他是否会接受这个职位。

sentences.en: He was sounded by his mother every day.
The child has a sound mind in a sound body.

means.word_mean: 明智的, 有判断力的, 正确的

sentences.en: That's very sound advice; you should take it.
sentences.cn: 那是非常明智的忠告, 你应当接受。

sentences.en: His voice sounds in my ears.
sentences.cn: 他的声音依然回响在我的耳旁。

sentences.en: The bugle sounded as the troops advanced.

jushi.english: His remarks had a worried sound.
jushi.chinese: 他说话的声音有些胆怯。

jushi.english: Strange sounds came from the next room.
jushi.chinese: 有种奇怪的声音从隔壁的房间里传过来。

jushi.english: The door was open, sounds came from the kitchen.
jushi.chinese: 门开着,从厨房传出各种声音。
